intro: Streptanthus maculatus, commonly known as the spotted rocket, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple, and its hairy, glandular leaves. Streptanthus maculatus typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in coastal areas and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
